channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: First Burials to Be Held for Israelis Returned From Gaza
item.description: Hamas has handed over the bodies of eight people, but says it is struggling to find the remains of others in Gaza after two years of war.

item.title: Nassau Police Charge Man With Raping and Killing Teenager in 1984
item.description: Theresa Fusco was left in the woods near the roller rink where she had worked. Three men were wrongly convicted, but authorities said they now have th...

item.title: Greetings from the Rhône Glacier, where a gash of pink highlights how it's melting
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: A Supreme Court ruling on voting rights could boost Republicans' redistricting efforts
item.description: A Supreme Court case over Louisiana's congressional map could determine the future of Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination and ...

item.title: Raila Odinga, Kenya's former Prime Minister, dies at 80
item.description: Raila Odinga — the towering figure of Kenyan politics who helped usher in multiparty democracy and a new constitution — has died in India at 80.

item.title: Cuomo Tries to Make Prostitution an Issue in NYC Mayor’s Race
item.description: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has criticized Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani over his past support for decriminalizing prostitution. Mr. Mamdani’s campaign h...

item.title: Study: We're losing the war against drug-resistant infections faster than we thought
item.description: Antimicrobial resistance is responsible for some 1.2 million deaths a year a year and contributes to millions more. Data in the new report shows that ...

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deal tested. And, Supreme Court hears case questioning voting rights
item.description: Israel pressures Hamas to hand over hostage bodies more quickly, testing the ceasefire deal. And, the Supreme Court takes up a major case on that coul...

item.title: First Burials to Be Held for Israelis Returned From Gaza
item.description: Hamas has handed over the bodies of eight people, but says it is struggling to find the remains of others in Gaza after two years of war.

item.title: Spies, Burgers and Bombs: After a New War, Old Wounds Resurface in Tehran
item.description: A deep sense of unease has gripped Iran since American and Israeli airstrikes in June, but on a recent visit to the capital, we found that many Irania...

item.title: A Lesson From the German Resistance That Applies Today
item.description: The best safeguard against tyranny is a legion of people who believe in an authority higher than any political program.

item.title: South Korea Targets Cambodia’s Scam Industry After Kidnappings, Torture and a Death
item.description: South Korea’s efforts are part of a widening international crackdown on criminal groups running online fraud schemes from Southeast Asia.

item.title: A Repressive Russian Ally Feels a Mysterious Thaw From the U.S.
item.description: Analysts say they are unsure what the Trump administration hopes to get out of its gifts and concessions to Belarus’s autocratic leader.

item.title: L.A. County Declares State of Emergency Over Immigration Raids
item.description: The move would allow county officials to provide financial aid to those affected by Immigration and Customs Enforcement raids.

item.title: A Curfew In Greenville, Miss., Is Working to Curb Violent Crime
item.description: In Greenville this year, leaders imposed a strict curfew to curb gun violence. So far, the approach is working, even as some question how far a city s...
